WorkItem.Description:
In the asp.net mv3 sample the the Hello from Store.Details() string does not appear in browser when switching to the /Store/Details.

The other two string appear. 
When I run the debugger it always seems to be the third address I type in.
For example if the first address type  
/Store  the browser displays  “Hello from Store.Index()”.

When I change the address to ./Store/Browse the browser displays "Hello from Store.Browse()".

Next When I change the address to ./Store/Details the browser still displays "Hello from Store.Browse()".


HOW COME “Hello from Store.Details()” is not displayed in browser

see web address
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/vs2010trainingcourse_aspnetmvc3fundamentals_topic3

for source code
WorkItem.Summary: Hello from Store.Details() not being displayed  in browser Excersie 2 Task 3
